medical_history.chief_complaint: Rapid onset of cutaneous squamous cell carcinoma of the penis.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The patient noticed an erythematous, violaceous, indurated papule on the right shaft of the circumcised penis 2 months after starting etanercept therapy, and presented to the dermatology clinic 3 and a half months after the therapy initiation due to concern about the rapid growth of the lesion.
medical_history.past_medical_history: 20-year history of psoriasis and associated joint involvement; previously received multiple drug therapies including methotrexate, cyclosporine, and hydroxyurea; no previous history of malignant skin disease.
